question.text:
Match List I with List II :
$\begin{array}{|l|l|r|l|}\hline & \text{List-I} & & \text{List-II} \\\hline A. & \text{Lipase} & I. & \text{Peptide bond} \\\hline B. & \text{Nuclease} & II. & \text{Ester bond} \\\hline C. & \text{Protease} & III. & \text{Glycosidic bond} \\\hline D. & \text{Amylase} & IV. & \text{Phosphodiester bond} \\\hline\end{array}$

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

solution.text:
The correct answer is option (2) as
$\begin{array}{|l|l|l|l|}\hline A. & \text{Lipase} & - & \text{Digests ester bond found in lipids.} \\ \hline B. & \text{Nuclease} & - & \text{Helps in digestion of phosphodiester bonds found in nucleic acids.} \\ \hline C. & \text{Protease} & - & \text{Helps in digestion of peptide bond found in proteins.} \\ \hline D. & \text{Amylase} & - & \begin{array}{l} \text{Digests/breaks the glycosidic bonds found in carbohydrates i.e., digest} \\ \text{starch into smaller molecules, ultimately yielding maltose, which in turn is} \\ \text{cleaved into two glucose molecules by maltase.} \end{array} \\ \hline\end{array}$
